subject: Re: [junit] Running the tests from JUnit 4.3 GUI
msgSnippet: I am a total fresher to Testing Tools as well as JUnit Around 6-8 months ago, I had attended a seminar on Development for Testing . There presentationon JUnit
messageBody:
I am a total fresher to Testing Tools as well as JUnit

Around 6-8 months ago, I had attended a seminar on "Development for Testing".
There presentationon JUnit was shown using the built-in swing gui of JUnit... I am not sure the version was 3.x something.

Now, the download available on the official website of JUnit is version 4.3
(I downloaded JUnit 4.3 las week...)

I am not even sure whether there is a gui in JUnit 4.3

Can I run the tests independently of any of the GUIs like Eclipse or NetBeans either on command line or through a GUI

All the docs that were in the download archive are based on version 3.8

I am getting the "NoClassDefFound" Error

Please help!!!


Regards,

Umesh

Wayne Fay <waynefay@...> wrote: What (exactly) is the error message you are receiving?

This is like calling your mechanic on the phone and saying your car
won't start and expecting a diagnosis without providing additional
information...

Wayne

On 4/6/07, Umesh Nayak <penguin.umeshn@...> wrote:
> Dear all,
>
> I have installed JUnit 4.3.
>
> I have also run
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests
>
> as instructed in the Installation steps to verify the installation
>
> However, I am not able to get the JUnit TestRunner Swing GUI up and running.
>
> Please help,
>
> Regards,
>
> Umesh
>
>
